metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10895 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
qutebrowser before version 1.4.1 is vulnerable to a cross-site request forgery flaw that allows websites to access 'qute://*' URLs. A malicious website could exploit this to load a 'qute://settings/set' URL, which then sets 'editor.command' to a bash script, resulting in arbitrary code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10895` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

qutebrowser - 1.1.1-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qutebrowser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.1-1ubuntu0.1').
